item.title: Qualcomm launches Snapdragon 8xc SoC for Windows devices - IT World Canada
item.description:
Qualcomm launches Snapdragon 8xc SoC for Windows devices  IT World Canada

On the heel of its Snapdragon 855 SoC announcement, Qualcomm announced the new Snapdragon 8xc SoC designed for Windows laptops. Qualcomm and ...

item.title: Qualcomm Announces Very First 7nm Chip For PCs - International Business Times
item.description:
Qualcomm Announces Very First 7nm Chip For PCs  International Business Times

Qualcomm has announced the Snapdragon 8cx compute platform, the very first 7nm chip that will power PCs. The Snapdragon 8cx is also a premium chip that will be deployed alongside the Snapdragon 850. The Snapdragon 8cx comes with an Adreno 680 GPU, a Hexagon 690 DSP, a Kyro 495 CPU and the Snapdragon X24 LTE modem. The chip has four performance cores and four efficiency cores. Qualcomm claims that the Kyro 495 will enable faster multi-tasking thanks to its larger cache than previous platforms. The chip is designed specifically for “Always-Connected” PCs — devices that are capable of being co...

item.title: The ACPC Is Transforming Into A Premium & Enterprise PC With The Snapdragon 8cx Platform - Forbes
item.description:
The ACPC Is Transforming Into A Premium & Enterprise PC With The Snapdragon 8cx Platform  Forbes

Qualcomm announces a new family of Snapdragon chipsets for PCs starting with the 8cx I posted yesterday on Qualcomm’s announcement about the Snapdragon 855 platform for 5G smartphones. While that was hard to top, today was just as exciting with the announcement of a new Snapdragon product and roadmap just targeting PCs. Qualcomm, with Microsoft on hand, announced the Snapdragon 8cx (the new nomenclature standards for Compute eXtreme). Qualcomm will have two roadmaps for PCs and mobile devices going forward. The PC roadmap begins with the 8cx. The block diagram for the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8c...

item.title: Android Circuit: New Galaxy S10 Plus Leaks, Three New Nokia Handsets, OnePlus 5G Confirmed - Forbes
item.description:
Android Circuit: New Galaxy S10 Plus Leaks, Three New Nokia Handsets, OnePlus 5G Confirmed  Forbes

Taking a look back at seven days of news and headlines across the world of Android, this week’s Android Circuit includes no notch in the Galaxy S10, the 5G S10 confirmed for America, the OnePlus 5G heading to the UK, three new Nokia handsets, a review of the Pocophone F1, Huawei’s ongoing security issues, and an innovation award for the Pixel 3 and 3XL. Android Circuit is here to remind you of a few of the many things that have happened around Android in the last week (and you can find the weekly Apple news digest here). No Notch, But There Will Be A Hole, In The New Galaxy S10 Samsung appe...

item.title: Qualcomm expands its PC bet with its new 7nm 8cx platform - TechCrunch
item.description:
Qualcomm expands its PC bet with its new 7nm 8cx platform  TechCrunch

Qualcomm wants to become a major player in the PC/laptop market. Now that there is Windows 10 on ARM, that's more than a pipe dream, but in its earliest iterations, those Qualcomm-based Windows 10 laptops used the Snapdragon 850 system on a chip that was specifically designed for PCs but still very much a direct descendant of its smartphone platform. Today, the company announced its Snapdragon 8cx platform, "the most extreme Snapdragon ever," in Qualcomm's parlance, which still leverages some of the company's mobile expertise and building blocks, but which was built from the ground up to po...

item.title: Taking aim at Intel, Qualcomm launches chip for business PCs - Reuters
item.description:
Taking aim at Intel, Qualcomm launches chip for business PCs  Reuters

Qualcomm Inc (QCOM.O: Quote, Profile, Research, Stock Buzz), the biggest supplier of chips for mobile phones, on Thursday pushed further into the PC market with a line of chips designed to power business machines. Qualcomm's "Snapdragon" processor chips historically have been at the heart of mobile phones like Alphabet Inc's (GOOGL.O: Quote, Profile, Research, Stock Buzz) Google Pixel phone and many Samsung Electronics Co Ltd (005930.KS: Quote, Profile, Research, Stock Buzz) devices. Over the past year, though, Qualcomm adapted its chips to operate PCs running Microsoft Corp's (MSFT.O: Quot...

item.title: Qualcomm Launches 5G With The Snapdragon 855 - Forbes
item.description:
Qualcomm Launches 5G With The Snapdragon 855  Forbes

The Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 platform supports 5G applications and connectivity We have all become accustomed to new, faster, and more efficient mobile processors, or more appropriately called System-on-Chips or SoCs, every year as the mobile industry continues to push performance and functionality to new levels. With the slowing of Moore’s Law, one would expect the performance enhancements to mobile SoCs to slow, but as Qualcomm demonstrated with the new Snapdragon 855, that is not the case. Dubbed the first 5G chipset by Qualcomm, the Snapdragon 855 is a significant increase in performance...

item.title: New Galaxy S10 Details Confirm Powerful Features - Forbes
item.description:
New Galaxy S10 Details Confirm Powerful Features  Forbes

Samsung has confirmed its continuing partnership with Qualcomm will see the South Korean company use the new SnapDragon 855 system on chip inside 2019′s Galaxy smartphones, starting with its first 5G device for US market. Both Verizon and AT&T have confirmed a 5G Galaxy smartphone will arrive in the first half of next year. While the connection was not explicitly made, Samsung’s VP of Product Marketing and Strategy, Justin Denison, confirmed that the upcoming US 5G smartphone from the South Korean company would be powered by Qualcomm’s SnapDragon 855 system on chip. The only handset we’re a...

item.title: OnePlus mulls the price of innovation - TechCrunch
item.description:
OnePlus mulls the price of innovation  TechCrunch

Qualcomm’s big Snapdragon Summit has become yet another battleground for smartphone oneupmanship, as companies duke it out around the latest flagship chips. OnePlus, which has carved out a name for itself by producing high quality handsets on a budget, clearly intended to use the Maui-based event to establish itself among innovation leaders in the category. Ultimately, however, it appears the Chinese manufacturer is leaving the show with a bit of egg on its face. CEO Pete Lau hit the stage this week backed by a slide proclaiming that the company’s 2019 handset would be the first to market w...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10 Rumored Specs, Features - International Business Times
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy Note 10 Rumored Specs, Features  International Business Times

Samsung’s successor to the Galaxy Note 9 won’t launch until the second half of 2019, but reports about its specs and features have begun trickling in this week. AT&T announced via its online newsroom on Wednesday that it is working with Samsung to bring another 5G-ready device to the United States in the second half of 2019. The announcement comes a day after the carrier confirmed that it’s launching a 5G-capable smartphone with Samsung in the first half of next year. Even without naming the two devices, it’s easy to tell that they are bound to be flagship phones. The device that’s coming o...

item.title: Apple's feud with Qualcomm probably isn't it. - International Business Times
item.description:
Apple's feud with Qualcomm probably isn't it.  International Business Times

Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) isn't likely to be among the first companies to introduce a smartphone with 5G wireless capability. On Dec. 3, Bloomberg reported that Apple "plans to hold off until at least 2020 before offering an iPhone that can connect to the next generation of high-speed phone services coming next year," referring to 5G connectivity. This article originally in the Motely Fool The report also went on to say that "[the] decision to sit on the sidelines may be related to the company's feud with Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) Inc., the leader in 5G-enabled chips, and its alliance instead with I...

item.title: Verizon, Samsung Prep 5G Smartphone For Launch Next Year - International Business Times
item.description:
Verizon, Samsung Prep 5G Smartphone For Launch Next Year  International Business Times

Verizon and Samsung Electronics are working to bring 5G-ready smartphones in the United States as early as the first half of 2019. The telecommunications company announced on Monday that it is planning to bring the first commercial 5G smartphones to the American market in collaboration with Samsung. The two companies are set to unveil a proof of concept at the Qualcomm Snapdragon Technology Summit in Maui this week. The proof of concept will be powered by the upcoming flagship Snapdragon SoC and the Snapdragon X50 5G NR modem and antenna modules. It will also feature integrated RF transceiv...

item.title: Qualcomm announces the Snapdragon 855 and its new under-display fingerprint sensor - TechCrunch
item.description:
Qualcomm announces the Snapdragon 855 and its new under-display fingerprint sensor  TechCrunch

This week, Qualcomm is hosting press and analysts on Maui for its annual Snapdragon Summit. Sadly, we're not there, but a couple of weeks ago, Qualcomm gave us a preview of the news. There'll be three days of news and the company decided to start with a focus on 5G, as well as a preview of its new Snapdragon 855 mobile platform. In addition, the company announced its new ultrasonic fingerprint solution for sensors that can sit under the display. It'll probably still be a while before there'll be a 5G tower in your neighbourhood, but after years of buzz, it's fair to say that we're now getti...

item.title: Qualcomm unveils new chip to power 5G smartphones - Reuters
item.description:
Qualcomm unveils new chip to power 5G smartphones  Reuters

Chip supplier Qualcomm Inc (QCOM.O: Quote, Profile, Research, Stock Buzz) on Tuesday unveiled a new generation of mobile phone processor chips that will power 5G smartphones in the United States as soon as next year. The key feature of the Snapdragon 855 chip, launched at an event in Hawaii, is a so-called modem for phones to connect to 5G wireless data networks with mobile data speeds of up to 50 or 100 times faster than current 4G networks. Mobile carriers are investing in 5G networks and are eager to sell 5G phones and data plans to recoup investment costs. Qualcomm, the largest supplier...

item.title: Smartphone Makers Adopting 5G Tech Next Year Revealed - International Business Times
item.description:
Smartphone Makers Adopting 5G Tech Next Year Revealed  International Business Times

All Android smartphone makers are going to release 5G-ready mobile devices next year, according to Qualcomm President Cristiano Amon. At Qualcomm’s Snapdragon Technology Summit in Hawaii this past Tuesday, Amon disclosed to CNET in an interview that all Android vendors are expected to launch flagship devices with 5G support by the end of 2019. “When we get to exactly this time of year one year from now we will see every [handset maker] on the Android ecosystem, their flagship across all U.S. carriers will be a 5G device,” Amon said. “Every Android vendor is working on 5G right now.” It’s no...

item.title: Moto G7 Power FCC Listing Reveals 5,000mAh Battery - International Business Times
item.description:
Moto G7 Power FCC Listing Reveals 5,000mAh Battery  International Business Times

Motorola is expected to launch four variants of the Moto G7. There are already leaked details about the standard Moto G7 and the Moto G7 Play, but now a fresh leak straight from the FCC is shedding some light on the Moto G7 Power. The Moto G6 only had three variants, but the Moto G7 will have four with the addition of the G7 Power. This particular model will sit between the Play model and the standard model of the G7, according to XDA Developers. The standout feature of the Moto G7 Power will be the inclusion of a massive 5,000mAh battery. For comparison, the G7 Play will have a 2,082mAh ba...

item.title: Living With An Always Connected PC (Part II) -- It Changed How I Use A PC - Forbes
item.description:
Living With An Always Connected PC (Part II) -- It Changed How I Use A PC  Forbes

The ASUS NovaGo always-connected PC I wrote a few months ago about my experience with the ASUS NovaGo, one of the first Always-Connected PCs (ACPCs) introduced earlier this year. But after making it my primary PC, I felt it was worth providing a little more insight into the platform. The ACPC is not a new platform, but the combination of longer battery life achieved using the Qualcomm Snapdragon SoC and seamless connectivity that switches between integrated Wi-Fi and cellular modems accomplishes something the PC segment has lacked for the past decade–new usage models. ASUS NovaGo convertibl...

item.title: Samsung will release a 5G phone in 2019 - TechCrunch
item.description:
Samsung will release a 5G phone in 2019  TechCrunch

Samsung tipped its hand yet again, revealing another key piece of its 2019 roadmap. As it did with the foldable phone a few weeks back, the company will be revealing a proof concept this week at the annual Qualcomm Snapdragon Summit in Maui. Details around things like specs are likely to be pretty light once again, though Samsung and mobile partner Verizon are shooting for a releasesometime in the first half of next year. Qualcomm is a key hardware partner here as well, producing the Snapdragon X50 5G NR modem and antenna modules via the Snapdragon Mobile Platform. The news finds Samsung jo...

item.title: Verizon, Samsung to release 5G smartphones in U.S. in 2019 - Reuters
item.description:
Verizon, Samsung to release 5G smartphones in U.S. in 2019  Reuters

Verizon Communications Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd on Monday confirmed long-held industry expectations they would seek to steal a march on Apple Inc by launching U.S. 5G smartphones in the first half of 2019. The two companies said in a statement they would unveil a prototype, using Qualcomm Inc's modem chips, at the chipmaker's annual Snapdragon Technology Summit in Maui, Hawaii this week. While Verizon is leading the charge to trial 5G in some cities next year, industry analysts say the higher-speed networks are unlikely to be widely available until the middle of the next decade. A...

item.title: Qualcomm, MediaTek Building Next-Gen SoCs - International Business Times
item.description:
Qualcomm, MediaTek Building Next-Gen SoCs  International Business Times

The year 2019 will usher in an era of more advanced wireless communication, so Qualcomm and MediaTek are preparing next-generation System-on-Chips (SoCs) that can keep up with 5G networks and new technologies. Industry sources told Digitimes on Thursday that the American semiconductor and telecommunications equipment company and the Taiwanese fabless semiconductor firm are moving to fabricate SoCs with advanced process nodes in hopes of maintaining their sales momentum next year. The move is also expected to help both Qualcomm and MediaTek make it through the period of uncertain smartphone ...

item.title: FCC Filings Reveal Moto G7 Play - International Business Times
item.description:
FCC Filings Reveal Moto G7 Play  International Business Times

In October, the specs for the Motorola Moto G7 were leaked online, revealing that the device will have a larger display. Now, the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has revealed the full specs for the less powerful variant, called the Moto G7 Play. The Moto G7 Play was first spotted on the FCC website by Droid Life. The filings appear to reveal everything about the upcoming device, including photos that show off exactly what what it will look like. The Moto G7 Play is listed with the model number XT1952 and is said to arrive in two colors: black and light blue. The Moto G7 Play appears...

item.title: Pixel 3 Lite Leak Reveals Same Camera, Cheaper Price - Forbes
item.description:
Pixel 3 Lite Leak Reveals Same Camera, Cheaper Price  Forbes

Both versions of Google’s Pixel 3 handsets offer some of the best camera technology currently available. However, as is the case with all flagship products, it comes with a hefty price tag. Google’s Pixel 3 camera could be coming to a much less-expensive handset. Now, according to perennial leaker @VenyaGeskin1, it seems the much-rumoured simplified Pixel 3 model will soon launch fitted with the same top-of-the-range camera as the current high-end models. More Google Pixel 3 Lite “Sargo” Photos: https://t.co/D9XCuLeQbU pic.twitter.com/XCvHprAugV — Ben Geskin (@VenyaGeskin1) 26 November 2018...

item.title: Qualcomm Expands R&D Team In Taiwan - International Business Times
item.description:
Qualcomm Expands R&D Team In Taiwan  International Business Times

Qualcomm Incorporated is actively expanding its local research and development (R&D) team in Taiwan in preparation for the dawn of the 5G era. This particular move is seen as the company’s way of getting closer to its Taiwanese partners including Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) while they work on 5G mobile chips. Industry sources told Digitimes on Friday that Qualcomm has already shifted some of its R&D resources from the United States to Taiwan in order for it to accelerate the development of its 5G chip solutions for upcoming smartphones. The American telecommunications ...

item.title: OnePlus Confirms Updated OnePlus 6T For Christmas - Forbes
item.description:
OnePlus Confirms Updated OnePlus 6T For Christmas  Forbes

Following on from the successful launch of the OnePlus 6T last month, OnePlus are set to launch an update to the critically acclaimed Android-powered smartphone alongside Formula 1 Grand Prix stalwarts McLaren. OnePlus 6T McLaren web page (oneplus.com) The event is taking place at the McLaren Technology Centre in Woking, England, on December 11th. Although no details have been released beyond a short promotional clip featuring memorabilia and archival footage from McLaren’s history, the slogan ‘Salute To Speed’ is intriguing. It might be a little bit too early to announce OnePlus’ first 5G...

item.title: Motorola 'Odin' Rumored To Be Powered By Snapdragon 8150 - International Business Times
item.description:
Motorola 'Odin' Rumored To Be Powered By Snapdragon 8150  International Business Times

Lenovo’s Motorola division didn’t have a great 2018, but that isn’t stopping the company from releasing Moto branded phones. A new rumor claims that Motorola is working on a new flagship Android phone powered by Qualcomm’s next-generation System-on-Chip. A source claims that the upcoming flagship is currently codenamed “Odin” and it might actually end up being called the Motorola Moto Z4, according to XDA Developers. The source also says that the Motorola “Odin” will be powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8150, the rumored name for the successor to the Snapdragon 845 platform. The Snapdragon...

item.title: OnePlus 6T Review: Competitors Have Caught Up In Value, But OnePlus Software Still King - Forbes
item.description:
OnePlus 6T Review: Competitors Have Caught Up In Value, But OnePlus Software Still King  Forbes

The OnePlus 6T has a 6.4-inch OLED display. The OnePlus 6T is the fifth phone from the upstart brand I’ve tested in a professional capacity, and this is the toughest one to judge. It’s not because the 6T isn’t good, or a step backwards. No, it’s the best OnePlus phone yet. But it’s trickier this time around because circumstances around the phone have changed. For years, OnePlus phones were undoubtedly the best value on the market. Other phones that ran on the same Snapdragon chipset almost always cost several hundred dollars more, and other phones in the mid-tier market were significantly l...

item.title: Some Galaxy Note 9 Units Suffer Camera Freezing Problems - International Business Times
item.description:
Some Galaxy Note 9 Units Suffer Camera Freezing Problems  International Business Times

The Samsung Galaxy Note 9 is one of the best Android smartphones of 2018, but it doesn’t mean that it is immune to problems. Some users are reporting that the camera on their Note 9 units are freezing for some unknown reason. Some Note 9 owners are complaining on the Samsung official forums that their camera was freezing every time they take a picture. In some cases, users would notice a bit of lag when they try to record videos using the Note 9’s default camera app. No one has pinpointed the cause of the problem, but some forum users have already found a temporary solution. Users who are e...

item.title: Huawei Teases New Smartphone With A Hole In Its Display - International Business Times
item.description:
Huawei Teases New Smartphone With A Hole In Its Display  International Business Times

Samsung is rumored to be preparing for the launch of the Galaxy A8s, which is said to be the first to come with a hole in its display. However, it looks like Huawei is releasing a smartphone with a similar design. Huawei recently shared a promotional image on its Weibo account. The image shows a silhouette of an unspecified smartphone. The image appears to be teasing a full-screen smartphone with a hole in its display at the upper left-hand side, which is symbolized by an oncoming comet. This type of display is very similar to the Infinity O display that Samsung teased earlier this month du...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S10 Budget Model To Feature Infinity O Display? - International Business Times
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S10 Budget Model To Feature Infinity O Display?  International Business Times

Samsung revealed during its annual developers conference last week that it was developing Infinity Displays with different types of notches. Now, a leaker may have revealed that one of those will be featured on the budget version of next year’s Galaxy S10. The budget model of the Galaxy S10 is said to arrive with a flat Infinity O display, according to Ben Geskin (@VenyaGeskin1). For those unaware, the Infinity O display was teased last week by Samsung as a screen with a small circular hole located near its edge. The notch will most likely house the front-facing camera and will only cover a...

item.title: What's The Outlook Like For Qualcomm After A Mixed Fiscal 2018? - Forbes
item.description:
What's The Outlook Like For Qualcomm After A Mixed Fiscal 2018?  Forbes

Signage for 5G mobile experiences is seen at the Qualcomm Inc. booth at the Mobile World Congress Shanghai in Shanghai, China, on Thursday, June 28, 2018. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg Wireless technology behemoth Qualcomm published its Q4 FY’18 results on Wednesday, November 7, reporting a better than expected set of results that were driven by stronger demand for the company’s chipsets from Chinese smartphone vendors, although this was partially offset by lower revenues from Apple. The company has guided for revenues of $4.5 billion to $5.3 billion for Q1 FY’19, marking a decline of ...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S10 May Arrive With Improved AI Photography - International Business Times
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S10 May Arrive With Improved AI Photography  International Business Times

There are already a bunch of rumors about the Samsung Galaxy S10, which is expected to arrive early next year. Now, a new report claims that Samsung is planning to add a dedicated AI co-processor to the device that would be responsible for powerful artificial intelligence and machine learning tasks. Specs for the AI co-processor are currently unavailable, but a report from the Korean website ETNews suggests that the neural processing unit (NPU) will arrive with two dedicated artificial intelligence cores. If this were true, then users should expect performance improvements when it comes to ...

item.title: OnePlus 6T's Biggest Threat Has Disappeared - Forbes
item.description:
OnePlus 6T's Biggest Threat Has Disappeared  Forbes

As the OnePlus 6T goes on full release across the world (including a US launch with T-Mobile USA), one of the biggest obstacles to a successful retail launch has been removed. OnePlus 6T (image: Ewan Spence) Thanks to the short product cycle of six months used by the Shenzhen-based company, the handset that the OnePlus 6T is replacing is effectively out of stock around the world. Launched in May this year, the OnePlus 6 also features the same SnapDragon 845, the same 6GB or 8GB RAM choices, and the same camera hardware as the OnePlus 6T. While the latest update to OxygenOS is available ‘out...

item.title: Three Stunning Surprises You Can See Inside The New Xiaomi Mi 8 Pro - Forbes
item.description:
Three Stunning Surprises You Can See Inside The New Xiaomi Mi 8 Pro  Forbes

Today saw Xiaomi enter the UK smartphone and consumer electronics with the launch of the flagship Mi 8 Pro smartphone, a solid portfolio of Android-powered handsets, a new store in London, and an electric scooter. How will Western markets take to the strange mix of Xiaomi’s consumer products, smartphones, and impactful branding? The bridgehead into the UK begins with the Mi 8 Pro smartphone. Xiaomi Mi 8 Pro (image: Ewan Spence) High Specifications At A Low Price Let’s face it, the table stakes for a flagship device make for a great phone. The Mi 8 Pro has the requisite SnapDragon 845 system...

item.title: What To Expect As Qualcomm Reports Q4 Results - Forbes
item.description:
What To Expect As Qualcomm Reports Q4 Results  Forbes

Visitors look at monitors in the Qualcomm Inc. booth at the World IT Show 2018 in Seoul, South Korea, on Wednesday, May 23, 2018. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg Wireless technology behemoth Qualcomm is expected to publish its Q4 FY’18 results on Wednesday, November 7, reporting on a quarter that is likely to see the company post a mixed performance amid slowing global demand for smartphones and the company’s ongoing licensing disputes with Apple. The company has guided for revenues of $5.1 billion to $5.9 billion for the quarter, with earnings projected to come in at $0.75 – $0.85 pe...

item.title: OnePlus 6T review: you'd have to spend double to get better than this - The Guardian
item.description:
OnePlus 6T review: you'd have to spend double to get better than this  The Guardian

The OnePlus 6T proves that cutting-edge technology doesn’t have to cost the Earth, bringing an in-display fingerprint scanner and a tiny notch for just £500. OnePlus has kept things simple for years, offering top specifications for budget prices. The price has slowly crept up to not-quite-so budget, but the level of refinement and technology has also improved. The OnePlus 6T builds on the already excellent OnePlus 6, by further cutting away anything that isn’t screen. The gorgeous, crisp and colourful OLED display is a smidgen bigger at 6.41in, with a smaller chin at the bottom and a tiny t...

item.title: OnePlus 6T: cut-price flagship launches with in-screen fingerprint sensor - The Guardian
item.description:
OnePlus 6T: cut-price flagship launches with in-screen fingerprint sensor  The Guardian

OnePlus is putting a stake in the ground with its latest smartphone, saying cutting-edge technology doesn’t need to cost the best part of £1,000. The new OnePlus 6T, which starts at £499, has an all-screen design and large 6.41in FHD+ OLED display, but this time shrinks the notch at the top to a more bearable tiny teardrop shape, slims the chin at the bottom of the screen and fits a fingerprint scanner directly into the screen. The rest of the metal and glass sandwich matches the OnePlus 6, released six months ago. It has Qualcomm’s top-end Snapdragon 845 processor, a choice of 6 or 8GB of ...

item.title: China’s OnePlus 6T has an American carrier in T-Mobile - Fast Company
item.description:
China’s OnePlus 6T has an American carrier in T-Mobile  Fast Company

After notching $1 billion in revenue and turning a profit last year, phone maker OnePlus is getting its first U.S. wireless carrier deal with T-Mobile, which will sell the just-announced OnePlus 6T in 5,600 retail stores. The OnePlus 6T bears several similarities to other high-end phones from Vivo and Oppo, which are also owned by parent company BBK, but don’t have wireless carrier deals. Most notably, it has a fingerprint reader built into the display glass–a first for the U.S. market–and just a small camera cutout near the top of the 6.41-inch screen. Other specs include a Qualcomm Snapdr...

item.title: Qualcomm Announces Snapdragon 675 Gaming Processor - International Business Times
item.description:
Qualcomm Announces Snapdragon 675 Gaming Processor  International Business Times

Qualcomm has announced a new chipset that’s also the successor to the Snapdragon 670, which was launched just three months ago. The new chipset is called the Snapdragon 675 and it focuses on delivering a better gaming experience on Android smartphones, as well as support for triple-camera setups. The Qualcomm Snapdragon 675 may be the successor to the 670, but it has a few downgraded specs. The new chipset is constructed with an 11nm process instead of 10nm. The integrated GPU is an Adreno 612 instead of the Adreno 615 that’s found on the Snapdragon 670, as pointed out by Android Authority....

item.title: Xiaomi Mi Mix 3 Hands-On: The Slider Phone With 10GB of RAM - Forbes
item.description:
Xiaomi Mi Mix 3 Hands-On: The Slider Phone With 10GB of RAM  Forbes

Lei Jun speaks at Xiaomi’s launch event for the Mi Mix 3 at the Palace Museum on Oct. 25 in Beijing, China. (Photo: Liang Shuang/Huanqiu.com/VCG via Getty Images) Xiaomi’s original Mi Mix, released in the fall of 2016, was an industry shaker that ditched several traditional smartphone hardware parts and ignored conventional design cues to achieve its at the time near-bezel-less look. Of course, the competition for jaw-dropping design has gotten much stiffer in 2018, a fact even Xiaomi founder and CEO Lei Jun admitted during yesterday’s launch event of the Mi Mix 3. The Xiaomi Mi Mix 3 (righ...

item.title: Google's New Hardware Showcases Its AI Capabilities - Forbes
item.description:
Google's New Hardware Showcases Its AI Capabilities  Forbes

Google held its annual hardware event in New York City last week. Google’s Pixel 3 launch was possibly one of the most heavily leaked launches in industry history, with virtually all of the specifications of the device unveiled before the event began. Google was very aware of this fact and cobbled together a montage of YouTubers discussing the leaks that played before the event began. However, Google still had some surprises up its sleeves, in regards to the software and AI capabilities of the Pixel 3 and other devices. Like previous Google hardware events, this wasn’t just about showcasing...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy A8s Might Feature A Hole In Its Display - International Business Times
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy A8s Might Feature A Hole In Its Display  International Business Times

Samsung has launched the Galaxy A6s and the Galaxy A9s in China. And now the company announced a third phone called the Galaxy A8s, which is rumored to feature a true bezel-less design. Samsung didn’t provide specific details about the Galaxy A8s, but it did say that the handset will come with a “first-time adoption” technology, according to Phone Arena. Samsung then showed a teaser image of what the Galaxy A8s might look like and it appears the device will have little to no bezels on all sides. The device that the company teased also doesn’t appear to have a notch anywhere in sight. Leaker...

item.title: Xiaomi Launches Black Shark Helo With 10GB RAM - International Business Times
item.description:
Xiaomi Launches Black Shark Helo With 10GB RAM  International Business Times

Xiaomi has launched the Black Shark Helo, the successor to the company’s original Black Shark gaming smartphone. The Black Shark Helo features some upgrades, including an AMOLED display and RAM configurations of up to 10GB. The Black Shark Helo comes with a 6-inch 2160 x 1080 AMOLED display, which replaces the LCD panel that’s on the first Black Shark phone. Switching to an OLED display means that the phone will be able to show deeper blacks and provide higher contrast ratio to produce brighter and more vibrant colors. An OLED display also means that users should be able to save on battery ...

item.title: Xiaomi Mi Mix 3 Arriving Next Week With 10GB RAM - International Business Times
item.description:
Xiaomi Mi Mix 3 Arriving Next Week With 10GB RAM  International Business Times

The Xiaomi Mi Mix 3 is one of the most highly anticipated flagship Android smartphones of 2018 and an interesting new detail has surfaced about the upcoming device. Xiaomi has officially revealed the launch date of the Mi Mix 3 and it also confirmed that the handset will have 10GB of RAM. Xiaomi revealed on Weibo today, as well as on Facebook and other social media platforms, that the Mi Mix 3 will launch in Beijing, China on Oct. 25. The Chinese phone maker also included an image suggesting that the handset will feature a pop-up mechanism for its camera. More importantly, the company confi...

item.title: Apple's New iPhones Have An Unfixable Problem - Forbes
item.description:
Apple's New iPhones Have An Unfixable Problem  Forbes

While they hide some great secret features, even Apple has been forced to admit its new iPhone XS (details) and iPhone XS Max (details) were shipped with problems. The good news is Apple fixed most of them, but new tests confirm there is one it can do nothing about… Putting to bed questions about real-world performance, popular YouTube site PhoneBuff enlisted the help of robotics and discovered that for all the iPhone XS and iPhone XS Max’s incredible CPU performance, battery life is a mess. Particularly the bigger model. Apple’s iPhone XS (middle) and iPhone XS Max (left) have a battery ...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy A9 With Four Rear Cameras Announced - International Business Times
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy A9 With Four Rear Cameras Announced  International Business Times

Samsung has officially announced the Galaxy A9, the very first smartphone to have four rear-facing cameras. The upcoming handset may be a mid-range device, but it will cost £549 or around $725 when it’s released in November. The Samsung Galaxy A9 looks a lot like a typical Samsung Android phone up front, but the vertically-aligned quad-camera setup on the back certainly makes it stand out from the rest. The handset comes with a 6.3-inch Super AMOLED display with a screen resolution of 2220 x 1080 and an 18:9 aspect ratio. Bezels on the sides are minimum, while the top of the display doesn't...

item.title: Razer Finally Delivers Chroma Color Excitement To Gamers With Razer Phone 2 - Forbes
item.description:
Razer Finally Delivers Chroma Color Excitement To Gamers With Razer Phone 2  Forbes

Following last year’s almost surprising launch of the Razer Phone, the Singapore-based Razer has updated its smartphone and announced the imaginatively titled Razer Phone 2. Last year’s model put the focus squarely on mobile gaming, and this year’s update carries on that mantle with the promise of “up to thirty percent more power”. That comes from the combination of Qualcomm’s SnapDragon 845 system on chip and the Adreno 630 graphics processing unit; along with improved cooling, the 5.7 inch screen with 120 Hz refresh, and the 4000 mAh battery. Forbes’ Ben Sin has taken a closer look at the...

item.title: Razer Phone 2 Specs, Price Revealed - International Business Times
item.description:
Razer Phone 2 Specs, Price Revealed  International Business Times

The Razer Phone 2 has officially been announced and it carries over most of the features as the original Razer Phone from last year. However, Razer has added some major upgrades to its new-generation gaming smartphone to deliver a more superior mobile gaming experience. The Razer Phone 2 still comes with a 5.7-inch LCD display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The display comes with a resolution of 1440 x 2560 and a 16:9 aspect ratio. It’s also covered in Gorilla Glass 5 instead of Gorilla Glass 3. Although the display on the Razer Phone 2 may be the same as the one that’s found on the original mo...

item.title: Galaxy S10 Leak Suddenly Exposes Samsung's Radical Smartphone - Forbes
item.description:
Galaxy S10 Leak Suddenly Exposes Samsung's Radical Smartphone  Forbes

Samsung is very excited about the Galaxy S10, and you should be too. The Galaxy range’s 10th-anniversary model will have slimmer bezels, an ’ultrasonic’ in-display reader, triple rear cameras, gradient colors and a 5G option. And now Samsung has accidentally leaked its next-generation chipset… Credit for the spot goes to eagle-eyed XDA Developers’ writer Max Weinbach who discovered it buried deep in Samsung’s code for its upcoming Galaxy S9 Android Pie update, alongside references to the folding Galaxy F. And the wider consequences are significant. The Galaxy S10 will be Samsung’s most amb...

item.title: Google Pixel 3 XL Early 'Review' Evokes iPhone XS Max - Forbes
item.description:
Google Pixel 3 XL Early 'Review' Evokes iPhone XS Max  Forbes

Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL. A fresh Pixel 3 XL “review” seems to confirm that Google has adopted key design facets of Apple’s biggest phone, as the Pixel’s release date nears. About halfway through a Pixel 3 XL “review” from Unwire.HK* (via Android Police) there is a telling image of the 3 XL next to the iPhone XS Max (see image below). If accurate, the Pixel 3 XL not only has the iPhone’s notch and its bezel-less (mostly) front but is similar in size, sporting a 6.3-inch display (vs the iPhone XS Max’s 6.5-inch), as the Unwire.HK review shows. Those are not trivial features since they pretty m...

item.title: Samsung Foldable Smartphone Mentioned In Galaxy S9 Android Pie Build - International Business Times
item.description:
Samsung Foldable Smartphone Mentioned In Galaxy S9 Android Pie Build  International Business Times

The latest and unreleased Android Pie firmware for the Galaxy S9 includes references to Samsung’s rumored foldable smartphone. The firmware files may have also revealed the name for Qualcomm’s successor to the Snapdragon 845 processor. References to Samsung’s foldable smartphone were first spotted by XDA Developers. The site was able to dig through the latest build of Android Pie for the Galaxy S9 and discovered a framework file that mentions “winnerlte.” For those unaware, Samsung’s foldable smartphone is rumored to have the codename “Winner.” The filename suggests that this handset is pow...

item.title: Sony Xperia XA3 Revealed In Leaked CAD Renders - International Business Times
item.description:
Sony Xperia XA3 Revealed In Leaked CAD Renders  International Business Times

Earlier this year, Sony launched the Xperia XA2 and XA2 Ultra. Now, a new leak has revealed that the company is working on a follow up to the Xperia XA2, called the XA3, which is expected to be announced early next year. Renders for the Sony Xperia XA3 were leaked by MySmartPrice and Steve Hemmerstoffer (@OnLeaks). The upcoming handset is shown to have significantly thinner bezels than its predecessor and it appears to have a 5.9-inch display with an aspect ratio of 18:9. It’s being speculated that the display will have a resolution of 1,080 x 2,160. The dimensions of the device are said to...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy A9 Will Have Four Rear Cameras - International Business Times
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy A9 Will Have Four Rear Cameras  International Business Times

Samsung will have a press event on Oct. 11 and it’s believed that the company will announce a new smartphone that features four cameras on its back. A new leak suggests that the upcoming device will be called the Galaxy A9 and it looks like most of its specs have already been revealed. Information on the Samsung Galaxy A9 was leaked by the German website AllAboutSamsung. The upcoming handset is said to arrive with a 6.28-inch full HD+ 2,220 x 1,080 AMOLED display and feature slim bezels. It’s also very likely that the handset’s display will have a tall aspect ratio of 18.5:9 much like Samsu...

item.title: New Huawei Smartwatch Revealed In New Leak - International Business Times
item.description:
New Huawei Smartwatch Revealed In New Leak  International Business Times

Everyone is already looking forward to the launch of the Huawei Mate 20, but it looks like Huawei will also be announcing a new smartwatch alongside its latest flagship Android phone. A new leak has revealed that the company will launch the brand new Huawei Watch GT later this month. The Huawei Watch GT was first discovered by the german website WinFuture. The upcoming smartwatch is said to arrive in two variants: Classic and Fashion. A third version of the device is also expected to arrive and it will be called the Watch GT Sport. The Sport model is said to have different colors for its be...

item.title: Oppo Might Release First Smartphone With 10GB RAM - International Business Times
item.description:
Oppo Might Release First Smartphone With 10GB RAM  International Business Times

In June, Oppo launched the Find X Android smartphone that featured a sliding mechanism for its pop-up cameras. Now it looks like the company is planning to release a new version of the Oppo Find X with 10GB of RAM. Notorious Twitter leaker Ice Universe (@UniverseIce) revealed that the 10GB RAM version of the Oppo Find X has already been certified by TENAA, the Chinese counterpart of the U.S. FCC. The TENAA listing shows that the upcoming variant of the Oppo Find X will arrive with 10GB of RAM and 256GB of onboard storage. As a refresher, the Oppo Find X launched earlier this year powered by...

item.title: How Qualcomm Escaped A $774 Million Antitrust Fine And Boosted Taiwan's Tech Hub - Forbes
item.description:
How Qualcomm Escaped A $774 Million Antitrust Fine And Boosted Taiwan's Tech Hub  Forbes

Qualcomm Inc. CEO Steve Mollenkopf speaks during a keynote address at CES 2017 at The Venetian Las Vegas in January 2017 in Las Vegas, Nevada. (Photo: Ethan Miller/Getty Images). What a difference a year makes. Last October, Taiwan’s Fair Trade Commission fined American chip developer Qualcomm NT$23.4 billion ($774 million). The commission found that Qualcomm had used its dominant position in the modem chip market to charge unfair royalties and terms for its patents. Taiwan matters because it accounted for 12% of the company’s fiscal revenue in 2016 through its sales to a long list of local...

item.title: Qualcomm's Snapdragon 3100 Platform Ushers In New Era Of Wearables - Forbes
item.description:
Qualcomm's Snapdragon 3100 Platform Ushers In New Era Of Wearables  Forbes

Wearables continue to become more functional and fashionable. While some continue to question the viability of the wearables market, each generation of devices is becoming more capable. The success of the Apple watch has certainly helped, along with the growth of companies like Fitbit, Mobvoi, and Garmin. I think we’re closer to the perfect smartwatch than ever before, and a lot of credit goes to Qualcomm, the chipmaker who has managed to effectively corner the market in the last several years. Yesterday, Qualcomm announced its next generation of its Snapdragon Wear processors, the Snapdrag...

item.title: Can Qualcomm See Wearables Success With The Snapdragon Wear 3100 Chip? - Forbes
item.description:
Can Qualcomm See Wearables Success With The Snapdragon Wear 3100 Chip?  Forbes

Signage for 5G mobile experiences is seen at the Qualcomm Inc. booth at the Mobile World Congress Shanghai in Shanghai, China, on Thursday, June 28, 2018. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg Qualcomm introduced a smartwatch chipset called the Snapdragon Wear 3100 at an event held on Monday, marking its first major smartwatch chip launch in over two years. The chip, which is based on an all-new architecture, will be crucial to driving Qualcomm’s growth in the wearables market, as the company looks for new avenues of expansion, considering its slowing smartphone SoC sales and headwinds at its ...

item.title: Qualcomm Demonstrates Performance In Wearables And IoT - Forbes
item.description:
Qualcomm Demonstrates Performance In Wearables And IoT  Forbes

Smartwatches are tied to fashion and lifestyle On Monday, Qualcomm announced a new platform for smartwatches dubbed the Snapdragon Wear 3100. Qualcomm first introduced the Snapdragon Wear platform with the Snapdragon Wear 2100 in early 2016 and followed by a series of other products aimed at anything from smart trackers to premium watches. While the market for wearables has been slowly developing compared to the catastrophic growth rate of smartphones, it is still growing, and Qualcomm has become the leader in Android-based smartwatches and other devices. The new platform combines four Arm ...

item.title: Qualcomm Snapdragon Wear 3100 Officially Announced - International Business Times
item.description:
Qualcomm Snapdragon Wear 3100 Officially Announced  International Business Times

Qualcomm has officially announced the Snapdragon Wear 3100, the company’s latest chipset designed for wearable devices. The new Snapdragon Wear 3100 promises to deliver improved battery life and will support features that will come to Wear OS smartwatches. The Snapdragon Wear 3100 was built from the ground up and isn’t simply a repurposed version of Qualcomm’s smartphone chipsets. The Wear 3100 comes with a quad-core processor that’s accompanied by the QC1110 co-processor. The inclusion of the QC1110 co-processor makes it possible to reduce power consumption while the smartwatch is on stand...

item.title: Qualcomm’s new smartwatch chip is here, but where is the flagship watch? - Fast Company
item.description:
Qualcomm’s new smartwatch chip is here, but where is the flagship watch?  Fast Company

Back in May, Qualcomm said it was working on a new smartwatch chip, telling Wareable that it would reveal the upgrade in the fall alongside a new lead smartwatch. And on Monday, Qualcomm made good on half of that promise by announcing the Snapdragon Wear 3100. The new chip–Qualcomm’s first for smartwatches in more than two years–adds a power-efficient co-processor, which allows the screen to always display the time in up to 16 colors, with a smoothly scrolling second hand and live complications. Unlike the Apple Watch, Qualcomm’s chip won’t make you flick your wrist upward to see the time. ...

item.title: Xiaomi's $300 Pocophone Vs. Samsung's $1,250 Galaxy Note 9: It's Closer Than You'd Think - Forbes
item.description:
Xiaomi's $300 Pocophone Vs. Samsung's $1,250 Galaxy Note 9: It's Closer Than You'd Think  Forbes

The Pocophone, left, and the Samsung Galaxy Note 9. Three years ago, Lenovo’s CEO Yang Yuanqing pulled his company out of the high-end smartphone battleground, saying that there were “too many Chinese vendors,” some of whom were “playing irrationally.” He was referring to the price war that saw — and continues to see — Chinese brands push smartphone pricing lower and lower in order to gain an edge. That price war is still going strong three years on. In fact, it may be more irrational than ever. I recently reviewed Samsung’s much-hyped Galaxy Note 9, and though I really liked the phone (so ...

item.title: Three Smartphones That Stood Out At IFA 2018 - International Business Times
item.description:
Three Smartphones That Stood Out At IFA 2018  International Business Times

IFA 2018 gathered a lot of tech companies, and among them are phone makers who opted to unveil their new handsets at the big Berlin exhibition. Below are three newly announced smartphones that stood out at the event. Sony Xperia XZ3 The Japanese company surprised everyone when it unveiled the Xperia XZ3 at IFA 2018 because it debuted the Xperia XZ2 just earlier this year. The handset does not come with a drastic design upgrade, but it caught a lot of attention due to the fact that it features an OLED display that is based on Sony’s BRAVIA TV technology, as pointed out by 9to5Google. The dev...

item.title: Huawei Kirin 980 Looks Good On Paper But AnandTech Benchmarking Accusations Could Indicate Otherwise - Forbes
item.description:
Huawei Kirin 980 Looks Good On Paper But AnandTech Benchmarking Accusations Could Indicate Otherwise  Forbes

Huawei has been on an up and down roller coaster related to smartphones as of late. On one hand, it achieved the number two global smartphone unit market share position surpassing Apple, only second to Samsung. Its premium smartphone market share is up, too, so it’s more than Huawei selling just cheap phones, and based on Moor Insights & Strategy analyst Anshel Sag’s analysis, the company has the best smartphone camera at this moment with the P20 Pro. I love the P20 Pro’s 3X physical zoom lens. Last week at IFA, Huawei announced the Kirin 980 processor and characterized it in its press rel...

item.title: Pixel 3: Google Confirms New Smartphones Launch For October 9 In New York - Forbes
item.description:
Pixel 3: Google Confirms New Smartphones Launch For October 9 In New York  Forbes

Next month, Google will unveil its latest flagship smartphone lineup, the Pixel 3, and perhaps an update to the Google Home product family of smart speakers and of the Pixel Buds headsets. (ELIJAH NOUVELAGE/AFP/Getty Images) Google sent out media invitations to its ‘Made by Google’ event which will take place on October 9 at Spring Studios in New York City. As I wrote previously, the tech giant will not announce any smartwatch running its latest Wear OS operating system but instead focus this fall on its flagship smartphone lineup, the Pixel, and perhaps an update of its Google Home product...

item.title: Samsung Resets The Business Phone Bar Again With The Note9, Three Weeks In Review - Forbes
item.description:
Samsung Resets The Business Phone Bar Again With The Note9, Three Weeks In Review  Forbes

The Samsung Galaxy Note9 The Samsung Galaxy Note9 is the next in a series of business and creativity-focused smartphone devices that Samsung has been releasing for many years. Because the Note line has traditionally been a second half of the year release, it comes out with a more refined feel than its “S” and “S+” brother. This year’s model is no exception with the New Samsung Galaxy Note9 shipping with the latest and greatest features and, of course, with a new stylus. This year’s Note9 is by no means a ground-breaking change from the Note8, but it makes many improvements across the board ...

item.title: Huawei's Kirin 980 Is The World's First 7-Nanometer Mobile Chipset With 5G Support - Forbes
item.description:
Huawei's Kirin 980 Is The World's First 7-Nanometer Mobile Chipset With 5G Support  Forbes

The Kirin 980 chipset. The results for the heated race to release the first mainstream 7-nanometer mobile processor are in, and Huawei has edged Apple to come in first. At the IFA trade show in Berlin today, Huawei’s consumer head, Richard Yu, unveiled the company’s next flagship chipset, the Kirin 980, and it is, as rumored, a 7nm SoC (systems-on-a-chip). Apple will almost certainly announce its own 7nm chipset on Sept. 12 during its iPhone launch, but for the record books, Huawei introduced it to the world first. So what is 7nm, and why does it matter? The “nanometer” part refers to the s...

item.title: HTC U12 Life Specs, Price And Release Date Revealed - International Business Times
item.description:
HTC U12 Life Specs, Price And Release Date Revealed  International Business Times

HTC has officially announced the HTC U12 Life, the mid-range version of its U12 Plus flagship that was released earlier this year. The U12 Life is also considered to be the direct successor to last year’s HTC U11 Life and it comes with a unique design. The HTC U12 Life will be available in two color options: twilight purple and moonlight blue. The handset’s back comes with a dual finish design. The top portion of the back is covered with acrylic glass, while the lower section has matte metallic finish. The metallic finish is also striped, giving the U12 Life a distinct look and feel from th...

item.title: Apple 6.5-inch iPhone XS Vs. Google Pixel 3 XL: Specs, Price, Release Date, Leaks - Forbes
item.description:
Apple 6.5-inch iPhone XS Vs. Google Pixel 3 XL: Specs, Price, Release Date, Leaks  Forbes

‘iPhone XS’ via 9to5Mac A fall showdown is set for the next monster flagship phones from two American tech giants. On one side, we have the Pixel 3 XL apparently just landing at the FCC. On the other side, we have the 6.5-inch iPhone with the “XS” branding* scheme. So, it’s time for a (preliminary) side-by-side. 6.5-inch iPhone: - Notch (front): integrates Face ID camera etc. - Display: 6.5-inch diagonal edge-to-edge, 2,688-by-1,242 pixel resolution - Processor: next-gen A12 - Frame: stainless steel - Camera: rear dual 12MP - Battery: extra-large battery (possibly 3,300 to 3,400 mAh) - Wire...

item.title: Sony Xperia XZ3 Announced With October Release Date - International Business Times
item.description:
Sony Xperia XZ3 Announced With October Release Date  International Business Times

Sony has officially announced the Xperia XZ3, the company’s latest flagship Android smartphone for 2018. The XZ3 borrows a lot of its features from the Xperia XZ2 that arrived earlier this year, but the new handset comes with a larger OLED screen. The Sony Xperia XZ3 comes with curved Gorilla Glass 5 up front and on its back. It’s available in four color options: black, white silver, forest green and Bordeaux blue. The XZ3’s design language is very similar to the XZ2 since it comes with the same curved edges for its body. However, the XZ3 has a 6-inch OLED display, which is probably the pho...

item.title: New Qualcomm Smartwatch Chip To Be Announced Next Month - International Business Times
item.description:
New Qualcomm Smartwatch Chip To Be Announced Next Month  International Business Times

Qualcomm previously confirmed that it will be releasing a new chip that will make its way to new Wear OS smartwatches this year. Now, the company has released an invitation to the press for an event, teasing that it will finally reveal its new Snapdragon Wear processor. The invitation from Qualcomm features a graphic of a watch with the tagline “It’s Time” and “Set your watches.” The invite also includes the date Sept. 10 and the weather information on the watch shows that the event will take place in San Francisco. Android Police shared the invite on its website. Qualcomm used to make smar...
